Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Happy Halloween, everyone! [notices Pam, in her cat costume] Oh... that's great!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey... Happy Halloween. Jan called.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh... OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know why she's calling. It's the end of the month, and I was supposed to let somebody go by the end of the month. And somehow I'm supposed to put on a costume and smile. [dials a number on his speaker phone] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: [on phone] Jan Levinson's office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Sherri. Michael Scott returning.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: Oh, she's in a meeting. Uh, she just wanted the name of the employee you let go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm gonna wait till the end of the day. Because the book said it's best to wait till the end of the day.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: I just need the name of who you're planning to let go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know... yet. I will have to call her back.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: I know she wanted the name.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... Sherri?

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you were getting fired, how would you wanna be told so you could still be friends with the person firing you?

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: Jan wants the name as soon as possible, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: Mm-Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll call her back. [talks softy, to himself] Wish I could fire Sherri.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm still here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No?

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Sherri
Quote.Text: Hanging up now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I mean you hear about layoffs in the news, but when you actually have to do it yourself, it is heavy stuff. It's... these are people's lives you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [entering] You wanted me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [notices Michael's costume] Papier-mache?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeeesh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, Pam, I have to let somebody go today. This is, uh, the hardest thing I've ever had to do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why did you put it off until Halloween?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because it's very scary stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think it's gonna put a damper on the party a little.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're worried about the party? There's a man's life at stake here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So it's a man?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Or a woman. A human life. If you had to guess, who it would be based on their job performance... and who you think deserved to be fired - who would that be?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just answer the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And... sometimes you just let it go to voicemail.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're costume is fantastic! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I sent away for it in July from a catalog. [bobs his head around, causing the costume head to jiggle around]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh no, don't, don't, don't, don't. [Michael laughs] Aah! [laughs, then leaves] Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, man. Okay, I have to fire somebody.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [eyeing Jim's costume] What is that?! What are you supposed to be?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm a three hole punch version of Jim. 'Cause you can have me either way. Plain White Jim, or Three-hole Punch.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's great!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, well look... [pulls his hood over his head and pops up his light saber] What about me?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What are you? A monk?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am a Sith Lord. [looks at Jim] Oh big deal. Three round pieces of paper taped to a shirt. This cost me 129 dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ass.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys excited about the party?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's gonna be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looks to Oscar] Oh, boy... look at you! Haha. Showing your colors. Bet you wish you wore a dress every day.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What are you implying?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All good. Happy Halloween. What happened to all those spooky decorations that we had? The cobwebs and such?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You know, I don't know. We put them all up last night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you know what? Go buy some more. I'll approve the overages. Sound good?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Oh, yeah, also about budget stuff. Um, I'm going to need you to find, like a, a full employee salary, plus benefits, like fifty grand. I'm going to need you to find 50 grand in the numbers.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But we don't keep two sets of books.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's not what I'm saying. Just, you know, find it. Pretend that your jobs depend on it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm-hm-hmm. Interesting take on Dorothy. I love it. Hey, you know what would even be better? Soccer ball and cleats.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why is that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "Bend It Like Beckham."

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, like ... the movie about the Indian girl who plays soccer?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] Yeah. That would be perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean, I guess I could do that. I don't really play soccer or anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I don't really have two heads. So...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, what are you again? Oh, right... Three-hole PUNCH! [punches Jim in the chest and cracks up laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, greatest strength.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, okay...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A dog-like obedience to authority

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But that doesn't sound good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Um, how 'bout, the ultimate team player? [Pam laughs and types]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight is... special. But, I don't believe that his talents are being used in this office. So Pam and I have put his resume on Monster.com, Google, Craig's List. We're really interested most in jobs that take Dwight out of state. Um, preferably Alaska... or India.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's a gun nut.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um. He sticks to his guns.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I looked through all the budgets. And there is one department...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: ... that has three people...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: ... doing the work that could be done by two.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This is great. [Angela shakes her head] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who do you think it should be?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim. Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Jim brings in money.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Eh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley. Pam. Oscar. Meredith. Kevin. Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not a popularity contest. Although it does make sense to fire the least popular because it has the least effect on morale.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One of the warehouse guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [turns to the fake head, listening] What? There was someone left off that list? Who?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who is he saying?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're right, I didn't even think of him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's actually a really good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, not me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah... I could.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not saying that's what he said.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know that's what he said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [listening to his head] What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Tell him, not Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is not a very nice thing to say about him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Tell him to stop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Quiet, you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I agree. He'd land on his feet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Make him be quiet.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Those aren't chips and dip.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I made brownies.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Uh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ... What?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm just trying to figure out why you're sabotaging things.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I made brownies.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And I made cookies. Same category.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm guessing Angela's the one in the neighborhood who gives the trick-or-treaters some toothbrushes. Pennies. Walnuts.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] Dunder-Mifflin. This is Pam. [listens] Uh, yeah. [snaps her fingers in the air, getting Jim's attention] Just one second. I will, uh, transfer you to our manager, Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... Whoa. [picks up ringing phone][in managerial voice] Michael Scott here. Yes, I am regional manager of this orifice. Mmm hmm. Dwight Schrute is amazing. Yeah. No, he is actually the single greatest employee of his generation. Mm hmm. You know what? I'm gonna tell you what. You hire Dwight K. Schrute, and if he does not meet, nay, exceed every one of your wildest expectations, well then, you can hold me, Michael Gary Scott, personally and financially responsible. Okay. Okay. Okay-kay-kay-kay-kay. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley, could you come with me, please.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: As Assistant Regional Manager...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: To the.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look! I've got some bad news. You're fired. You need to pack up your things and go. [Stanley laughs.] I'm serious, Stanley. It's over. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [laughs, and imitates Donald Trump] You're fired. Get your fingers off my phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So. How did it go with Stanley? How... how'd he take it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He wouldn't listen to me

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you want to fire him, you're going to have to tell him yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't wanna fire Stanley. I never said that. I'm certainly not going to do it myself. Get those big, baleful, eyes staring at me. Yikes. Just, okay, just... [waves Dwight away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering on the phone] Cumberland Mills?! And how did you get my resume? Oh no, no. I'm very flattered. Don't get me wrong. I'm just not sure that it's my official resume or if it's something that maybe a satisfied customer posted online. What does it say under martial arts training? Oh. Okay, I'm gonna have to supplement that. Could I have your fax number?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Would I ever leave this company? Look, I'm all about loyalty. In fact, I feel like part of what I'm getting paid for here is my loyalty. But, if there were somewhere else that valued that loyalty more highly, I'm going wherever they value loyalty the most.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh... hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, your dress is stuck in the back. Kind of just...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh. [fixes his dress]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] So you got the fax? So why didn't you add it to the res... ? What do you mean? Of course martial arts training is relevant. Oh, excuse me! I know about a billion Asians that would beg to differ. Uh, yeah, I get a little frustrated when I'm dealing with incompetence. Well, you know what? You can go to hell, too. And I will see you there... burning. Fine! Okay... oh wait! So you'll let me know when you've made a decis... [stops and hangs up phone.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim is really talented. And he should be the one who's getting a better job offer. Like, for real.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't take this the wrong way, but... you should go for that job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... it's in Maryland.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I mean, look at the salary. And it's definitely a step up. And a challenge.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah. You know what? Maybe... maybe I will. [starts walking away]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is called leveraging an offer. [walks into Michael's office] Michael, can I talk to you for a moment?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just thought you should know that I was just offered a job with better pay, better benefits and a better title at Cumberland Mills.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fantastic!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I turned it down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?! That would've solved all my problems.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Out of loyalty to this company...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ... so I was hoping to be made Assistant Regional Manager officially.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you left, I wouldn't have to fire anybody.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But then you wouldn't have me here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Big deal. Oh, it would've worked out so well. Can you get it back?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's in Maryland.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can call. Can you call 'em?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't. I... I suppose I coul... no. They never really made me an offer anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wohahah! Why are you torturing me?! God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Honestly, I don't think Michael has the slightest clue of who he's gonna fire. I think he keeps hoping that someone's going to volunteer. Uh, or be run over by a bus before the deadline. But in the end, really, what's going to happen is it's gonna be the first person to give him a dirty look in the hall. And therein lies the true essence of his charisma.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [clearing his throat and interrupting Jim's talking head] Can I speak to you a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, I really didn't mean to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Help. Me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to role play firing me. I want you to fire me, and I will take it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you want me to be you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to be me, and I will be Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, are you firing Creed?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. That's just the first thing... came... in head.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We should switch seats in order to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, that's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. [they stand up] Excuse me.[They sit down] I'm really sorry, but I have to let you go. And it's purely budgetary. It's not personal...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aaaahh! I'm gonna kill myself!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to kill myself, and it's your fault!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's an overreaction.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Corporate is really breathing down my neck. And they're saying this has to be done by the end of the month.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is this you? Are you being you, or is this Creed? Are you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... this is Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm improvising, so just try to keep up. [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hold that thought. Hold that thought.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I'm very angry, and I want...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [picks up the phone] Michael Scott here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm gonna kill you. I'm going to kill you for firing me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Toby? Mm hmm. [looks back to Michael] I really have to take this Creed, so it was really worth...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get off, get off. No, no. OK.. just get off.[sits back down in his chair and waves Jim off.] Just, just... yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It wasn't me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. That was like crazy. 'Cause I was...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, hey... Creed?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are great. Very ambitious. And I feel like you want more than this little office has to offer. And I understand that you'd wanna just spread your wings, and fly the coop.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What are you telling me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... we're gonna have to... You... you want something better.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No, I don't. I wanna stay right here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you wanna leave.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No, I wanna stay here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why... why are you making this so hard?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Um, I think there's a misunderstanding, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think you're right.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Can I go?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, of course you can't go. We haven't even started this horrible process of... okay, Creed. I need to let somebody go today. They told me I need to let somebody go. And as much as I think you're a great guy, and I like you, you're... you're, goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Let's fight it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Let's call Jan and fight this thing together like the old days.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What old days? What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Did you start the paperwork yet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's right here on the desk, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You don't have to do this, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't, I can't...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Undo it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't change anything. This is the way...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No, you have the power to undo it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't... okay, just listen.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Michael, undo it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I went hunting once. Shot the deer in the leg, had to kill it with a shovel. Took about an hour. Why do you ask?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have to fire someone today, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Fine. Fire someone else. Fire Devon. He's terrible. I am so much better at my job than Devon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well... I already picked you. And you know that. So, unless I just go through with this, you're always gonna look at me as the guy who almost fired you.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no, no. I will forget so fast. You will be my savior. You're they guy who gave me my life back. Thank you. I knew you'd see it my way Michael. God Bless you. You're a fine man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Listen, you will not regret this either. Devon is terrible; No one's gonna miss him. Good, good, good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Devon, could I talk to you for a sec?

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: Creed's an idiot, you know that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, he...

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no, no! You had it right the first time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, maybe I did.

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: Exactly. You gotta go with your gut, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh. No! I can't, no. I can't go back. I would look like an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: That's why I'm being fired?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: So you might not look like an idiot?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. It was all the stuff that I said. It was the business downturn, the cutbacks, and, and...

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: This is unbelievable!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just hope that you and I can remain friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Devon, wait, please.

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: What!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, look. In addition to severance, and everything, I want to give you this gift certificate to Chili's. From me. Okay? No hard feelings.

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: [takes the gift certificate and tears it up] Kevin, Jim, Pam, Kelly, Toby, Oscar, Meredith, Phyllis, Stanley, or the temp. If any of you wanna meet me for a drink, I'm going to be at Poor Richard's. And the rest of you can go to hell!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [watching nearly everyone leave] What about the Halloween party?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, Jim. Wait, stop. Um, I'm sorry... for pushing you towards Cumberland. Seriously, if you left here, I would blow my brains out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [motions for her to follow him] Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's just a figure of speech, you know? Blow your brains out? Come on. All it really means is that we're friends. Who else is she gonna talk to if I'm gone, right? I mean, if she left, I wouldn't blow my brains out. Of course, I would take that job in Maryland. Because it's double the pay, and soft shell crab just happens to be my favorite food.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love Halloween. You know, it's just, it's just fun. Every year, it's just fun. Last Halloween I came as Janet Jackson's boob. It was topical. People got a... a big kick out of it. The year before that, I came as Monica Lewinsky, and I wore a stained dress. The year before that, I also came as Monica Lewinsky. And before that, I was O.J. It was pretty funny. Oh, I wish you were here last year.

Quote.Speaker: Children
Quote.Text: [ringing the doorbell of Michael's Condo] Trick or treat!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He... Hey, hey, hey, hey! How you doing? Wow! You guys looks great.

Quote.Speaker: Kid
Quote.Text: I'm a bumble bee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You look great! And you're a princess?

Quote.Speaker: Kid
Quote.Text: A fairy princess.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A fairy princess. You're very... .

Quote.Speaker: Kid
Quote.Text: I'm a lion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're a lion. [trying to to open a bag of candy] Wow, I want to hear your, your... Oh! [the bag tears open, spilling all the candy] Oh, okay, that's all yours. That's all yours. Grab it, grab it. You know what? You guys are getting all of these.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you. Big Jim. And Phyllis. Working hard, Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course. You're always working hard.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Keep it up. And there's Stanley. No costume? Well, no, not trying to fit in. I wish I had your confidence, I really do.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Something wrong, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. What could possibly be wrong? Everything's great. Just keep living your lives. Everything's gonna be fine. [sighing] You are all such wonderful, innocent people.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's up, Hef?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, do you have the name of the employee you're letting go? I'd like to start working on out-placement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fine. If you are so anxious to see a head roll, it's you. There. You brought it on yourself. Too bad. Can't say that I'm sorry. It's a relief.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't report to you, Michael. I report to the head of HR in New York.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You asked for a name, I gave you a name. Now you're not doing your job. Why don't you just resign?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: They would just send someone else. You need to have an HR representative.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just know that if I could have fired you, I would have.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I know, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to have to do this Sopranos-style. Just whack him. Guys, could you take the freight elevator, please?

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
Quote.Text: Hey, you wanna see a really messy show? Follow us around. Come to our office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? That's my foot.

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #2
Quote.Text: Ass, ass, ass...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys...

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #2
Quote.Text: ...ass, ass, ass, ass, ass...

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
Quote.Text: Hi, Mom!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will handle it in the best way possible, but in case he or she goes postal, you will be available to subdue. Am I correct?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. Hey, are you on our payroll or are you employed by the building?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Building.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, shoot. Okay, well, just have your pepper spray ready.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: You're on your own.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. All right, this is it. By the time I get back to our floor, I will have decided. [elevator bell dings] Wow, that's a fast elevator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a proposal, everybody. Listen up. Now, Corporate has been really breathing down my neck to make some pay cuts, but I refuse to fire anyone. So, I was thinking that maybe all of you would take a 10% pay cut and that would save the money. Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah, We're not doing that. I have kids in college. Make a decision.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, great. Fine. Well, then, if anyone is annoyed later at what goes down, you know who to blame. Stanley. Not the guy who was trying to be creative. [turns around to find Toby standing behind him]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael, it's almost 5:00.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Leave me alone, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you want some coffee?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No, no. I had some, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [slurping] Oh, wow. How long have you worked here? How many years, Creed?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Fifteen years, I think.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's right. Fifteen years and three months. Wow, you were hired before I was. Must be thinking about retirement.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh, no. I need the money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What do you mean, "Why?"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's just that you never got married and you live in an apartment.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't know. I got nephews.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah. And I buy them stuff, you know. Oh, made some bad investments. Why are you asking me this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just trying to be your friend.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Well, you never asked me about my life before, is all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course, I did. I always... Yes, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Do you have something specific you wanted to talk to me about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you pulling my leg or...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have no clue why I've asked you in here?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I do not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, here we go. This... um, here's the deal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Actually, I have. I have been on a hunting trip. I shot a deer in the leg. I had to... I had to hit him, I had to hit him with a shovel for about an hour, so he... That's good eating, though. Venison's very gamey. It's hard to watch, though. It's hard to... It's hard to hit another living thing in the face with a shovel for about an hour. That... I haven't been hunting since then. I, I... 'Cause that's, you know, where's the joy in that? Where's the... There's no sport, really. Especially when you're the one with the shovel. And they're the one just lying there. Um... I would have rather hit it with my car or something and just... I was just smacking the hell out of that thing. That was a mess. And we just left him there. I didn't eat it. I didn't want to eat that. That guy. Why do you ask?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on the phone] This is Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: His name was Devon.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The human being man's name was Devon.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Devon. The... Oh, is this the man that you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking over Jan] Yes, yes, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: The person that you fired, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, it is.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Is that what you're... Okay. Oh, you sound a little... A little upset.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, well, I am. A little. Justifiably. My Halloween is ruined.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I have to say that I am impressed, Michael. I know... I know how hard that was.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you? I don't think you do. Devon was one of my best buddies. And now he hates me.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I'm glad you did it, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking over Jan] You're glad?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And so, good job. Good job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks. Thanks so much. You think it was good?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah. Good job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [talking over Jan] Think I did a good job? Great. I feel good. I'm gonna give myself a pat on the back.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [talking over Michael] Yup. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There. I'm doing it. Right there. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're supposed to be a cat?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You know, guys, Michael has really incredible decision-making abilities. Michael's really incredible at making decisions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [camera pans over, Michael is sitting in a chair] Yeah, blah, blah, blah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pussy. Here, pussy. Pussy. Pussy. Here, pussy, pussy. Meow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You people are revolting. By far, the least popular people here. I should have fired you. Who knew Devon was so popular and had so many friends. So well-loved.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I feel like I made the right choice. Things happen for a reason. I wasn't destined to go to Cumberland Mills. Just like Anakin Skywalker was destined to become Darth Vader, I am destined to sell paper here at Dunder Mifflin. That's what I was put on this earth to do.
